solution_line_template: First find the total bug population after spraying: {spray_reduction_percent_num}% * {initial_bug_population} bugs = <<{spray_reduction_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{initial_bug_population}={bugs_after_spray}>>{bugs_after_spray} bugs
Then find the total number of bugs each spider eats: {num_spiders} spiders * {bugs_per_spider} bugs/spider = <<{num_spiders}*{bugs_per_spider}={bugs_eaten_by_spiders}>>{bugs_eaten_by_spiders} bugs

Then subtract that number from the number of bugs left after spraying to find final number of bugs: {bugs_after_spray} bugs - {bugs_eaten_by_spiders} bugs = <<{bugs_after_spray}-{bugs_eaten_by_spiders}={remaining_bugs}>>{remaining_bugs} bugs
